div.l: That hath ben twyes hot ⁊and twyes cold
Of manye a pilgrym hast þᵘou c̉ristis curs
For of thȳn ꝑpersele ȝit thy fare þe wers
That þey hān etȳn with thȳn stobil goos
For in thȳn schoppe is manye a flye los
Now telle on gentyl roger be þȳn name
But ȝit I preye þe be not wroth for game
A man may sey ful soth in game ⁊and play
Thow seyst ful soth ꝙquod roger be mȳn fay
But sooth pley quaad pley as þᵉ flemyng seyth
And þ̉erfore herry bayly be þȳn feyth
Be þᵘou not wroth er we partȳn here
Thow þᵗat myn tale be of an ostelere
But natheles I wele nat telle it ȝet
But er we parte I wis þᵘou schat be quit
And þ̉erwithal he low ⁊and made chere
And seyde hese tale as ȝe schal aftyr here
Here begȳnnyst the kok of lūndene hi tale
